description: System-defined name/key for the notification template, typically reflecting the triggering event or default usage. Used to uniquely identify and select the template.
Subject line template for the notification. Supports runtime placeholders that are replaced with event or record details.
Priority level guiding delivery or emphasis; used by notification channels to flag urgency.
HTML-formatted body of the notification template. May include placeholders populated at send time.
Plainâ€‘text version of the notification body for channels that do not render HTML; includes placeholders resolved at send time.
Number of time units to delay sending after the triggering event. Combined with delay_uom to schedule notifications.
Time unit for delay_count (e.g., minutes, hours, days); defines the delay interval after the event.
User or process that created the template record.
Timestamp when the template was created.
User or process that last modified the template.
Timestamp when the template was last updated.
Business object category the template targets; used to select templates by context (such as work orders, requests, or purchase orders).
Whether a PDF should be attached to the notification (likely a generated report); confirm behavior with SME.
Identifier of the report definition to generate and attach with the notification when enabled; likely references a reporting catalog; confirm linkage with SME.
